page.title: 02Blakedown School
page.content: {Blakedown Church Of England School}was built in 1885 and so is holding a centenary celebration this year. There are two parts to the building, the second year pupils work in the original building and the remaining children work in the 'new' block which is about 35 years old. There is a small gymnasium where the children have Physical Education. This hall is also used as a dining hall. A small reading library is in the main hall. The children occasionally go for services in the nearby church. Children attend from 4 or 5 years to 9 years old. There are three teachers including the Headmaster. Control is held by the Board of Governors, nominated locally, who are responsible to the County Education Committee.
